titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The Domestic Missionary Society is affiliated with the American Home Missionary Society. It provided funds to support the gospel ministry of several churches "situated on the border of the Schuylkill River, at Manayunk, Reading, Pottsville and Portcarbon" along with the First Presbyterian Church of Southwark. The constitution of the Society states the "purpose of the society is to spread the gospel among the destitute and assist congregations which are unable to support the gospel ministry."

scopecontent.p: This collection is comprised of minutes of the Domestic Missionary Society of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 1826-1836; a constitution; and a few loose items including a letter soliciting financial support, a financial statement, and an annual report from 1835.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
